title: Escaped Markdown table column separator renders with escape char in code span in Rust doc
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

Writing a Markdown table in a Rust doc string, I noticed a case where the `|` character needs to be escaped, but the escape shows up in code spans.

```rust
/// | table |
/// |---|
/// | `T \| null` |
```

I want the rendered code span to look like `T | null`. If I use the code above, it renders as `T \| null`. If I remove the `\`, the table gets messed up because the `|` is interpreted as a column separator. IMO the more reasonable thing would be if `|` inside a code span was never interpreted as a column separator.

Then again, in GitHub it seems to render correctly with the escape, so maybe that's the correct way:
```
| table |
|---|
| `T \| null` |
```
| table |
|---|
| `T \| null` |
```
| table |
|---|
| `T | null` |
```
| table |
|---|
| `T | null` |
